# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Certainly! Here's a function `wrap_string` in Julia that adds a newline each time a specified maximum `text_width` would be exceeded:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)::String
    words = split(text)
    current_line_length = 0
    lines = []
    current_line = []

    for word in words
        if current_line_length + length(word) + length(current_line) > text_width
            push!(lines, join(current_line, " "))
            current_line = []
            current_line_length = 0
        end
        push!(current_line, word)
        current_line_length += length(word)
    end

    push!(lines, join(current_line, " "))  # add the last line
    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```

### Example:

```julia
text = "This is an example sentence that will be wrapped."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text, 10)
println(wrapped_text)
```

The output will look something like:

```
This is an
example
sentence
that will
be wrapped.
```
